; This file was edited using TECkitMappingEditorU.exe v3.0.1.0 on 6/3/2008.
;   Conversion Type = Legacy_to_from_Unicode
;   Left-hand side font = Cam Cam SILDoulosL;14.25
;   Right-hand side font = Doulos SIL;14.25
;   Main Window Position = 0,0,650,708
;   Left-hand side Character Map Window Position = 650,0,494,442
;   Right-hand side Character Map Window Position = 650,442,545,501
;   Left-hand side code page = 1252

;Cameroon2Unicode.map
;Copyright (c) 2003 SIL Cameroon.

; Draft TECkit mapping file generated by Encore2Unicode from cam2dr.ttf
; Reviewed and edited by David Thormoset, Yaounde, Cameroon
; contexts added for reverse mapping
;
; 04-Jun-2008 Bob Eaton (silconverters_support@sil.org)
; Per David's suggestion, I changed the map so that 0x8A (which is really
; latin_small_letter_script_g) be turned into U+0067 (which is latin_small_letter_g)
; and then if someone really wants the script g, they use a special literacy font
; which has script_g as U+0067.
; Also, I think an earlier version of this map used to turn 0x8A into 
; latin_small_letter_script_g (i.e. U+0261), so that now reverses also to 0x67, so
; that the reconversion of earlierly converted data works correctly.

EncodingName            "Cam2-1992"
DescriptiveName         "Cameroon Legacy Fonts to Unicode"
Version                 "1.1"
Contact                 "mailto:computer_dept_cameroon@sil.org"
RegistrationAuthority   "SIL Cameroon"
RegistrationName        "Cameroon Encoding"

ByteClass [CTL] = (   0x00 .. 0x1f   )
UniClass  [CTL] = ( U+0000 .. U+001f )
[CTL]	<>	[CTL]

UniClass[iWidth] = (U+0069 U+0268 U+0131)	; i-width
UniClass[mWidth] = (U+006D U+0077 U+00E6 U+0153)	;m-width
UniClass[oWidth] = (U+0061 U+0251 U+0065 U+025B U+0259 U+006F U+0254 U+00F8 \
U+0075 U+0289 U+0079 U+006E U+014B)	; o-width
UniClass[iWidthCap] = (U+0049 U+0197)	; i-width - high 
UniClass[mWidthCap] = (U+004D U+0057 U+00C6 U+0152)	;m-width - high
UniClass[oWidthCap] = (U+0041 U+F208 U+0045 U+0190 U+018F U+004F U+0186 U+00D8 \
U+0055 U+F218 U+0059 U+004E U+014A)	; o-width - high
UniClass[DiacritO] = (U+0300 U+0301 U+0302 U+030C U+0304 U+0303 U+0308 U+030D \
U+F171 U+F172 U+F173 U+F174)	; upper diacritic
UniClass[DiacritU] = (U+0330 U+0323 U+0327)	; lower diacritic

ByteDefault 42
UniDefault U+002A

0x20	<>	U+0020	; space  --  space
0x21	<>	U+0021	; exclamation_mark
0x22	<>	U+0022	; quotation_mark
0x23	<>	U+0023	; number_sign
0x24	<>	U+0024	; dollar_sign
0x25	<>	U+0025	; percent_sign
0x26	<>	U+0026	; ampersand
0x27	<>	U+02BC	; apostrophe - In CamCam, rounded Glottal stop
0x28	<>	U+0028	; left_parenthesis
0x29	<>	U+0029	; right_parenthesis

0x2B	<>	U+002B	; plus_sign

0x5C	<>	U+005C	; reverse_solidus
0x5D	<>	U+005D	; right_square_bracket
0x5E	<>	U+005E	; non_combining_circumflex_accent
0x5F	<>	U+005F	; low_line
0x60	<>	U+2018 	; single open quote
0x61	<>	U+0061	; latin_small_letter_a
0x62	<>	U+0062	; latin_small_letter_b
0x63	<>	U+0063	; latin_small_letter_c
0x64	<>	U+0064	; latin_small_letter_d
0x65	<>	U+0065	; latin_small_letter_e
0x66	<>	U+0066	; latin_small_letter_f
0x67	<>	U+0067	; latin_small_letter_g
0x67   <      latin_small_letter_script_g   ; in case we're reversing from data that was previously producing by an older version of the map that produced script_g forms
0x68	<>	U+0068	; latin_small_letter_h
0x69	<>	U+0069	; latin_small_letter_i
0x6A	<>	U+006A	; latin_small_letter_j
0x6B	<>	U+006B	; latin_small_letter_k

;0x7F	<>		; not_in_Cam_Font
;0x80	<>		; not_in_Cam_Font
;0x81	<>		; not_in_Cam_Font
0x82	<>	U+0330 / [iWidth] [DiacritU]? _	; i-width_combining_tilde_below
0x83	<>	U+0330 / [iWidthCap] [DiacritU]? _	; i-widthCap_combining_tilde_below

0x8A	 >	U+0067 	; in CamCam this is really latin_small_letter_script_g, but David Thormoset suggests it should become just the simple letter_g
0x8B	<>	U+2039	; single_left_pointing_angle_quotation_mark

;0x8E	<>		; not_in_Cam_Font
;0x8F	<>		; not_in_Cam_Font
;0x90	<>		; not_in_Cam_Font

0x94	<>	U+201D	; right_double_quotation_mark
0x95	<>	U+2022	; bullet
0x96	<>	U+2013	; en_dash
0x97	<>	U+2014	; em_dash
0x98	<>	U+02DC	; small_tilde
0x99	<>	U+2122	; trade_mark_sign
